author: Dean Maessen
comment: I've been using this app for many years and it's been great but recently after an update it signed me up to a $10/month SMS service WITHOUT ASKING ME. I sent STOP but it has already charged my phone account the $10. Instant uninstall.. not impressed.

author: Iain Bonnes
comment: Updates stopped. Widget doesn't open when tapped. Tried to reinstall, and now when I select a widget, no widget appears in place on screen. 23/03/2017 Reinstalled it, on my HTC after an update, and everything was working well, for the last 8 months. Yesterday the App stopped updating. NO information at all. No temp, current or forecast info. Tried to refresh, and informed unable to update as no auto-location available. Strange since I had set it to use a specific city, Adelaide. Went in and selected Adelaide again, did a refresh and it went back to using auto-location. What The ... ! Funny thing is, I have this app on my Samsung tablet, and it's working fine. This is annoying, as this app is one of the few with a 4x1 widget that is easy to read and well laid out. Tried reinstall, to no avail. I select the 4x1 widget, and despite it asking for set up data, nothing appears on my home screen.

author: Kris McDonall
comment: I only used this app for the status bar temperature. As it used BOM weather, it's the most accurate weather app with that functionality. However, you can't use it outside of Oz, and you can't display temp in status bar without having a widget somewhere on your screen. It has also stopped updating the past few months (my wife and I have both experienced that problem on different devices). Uninstalling.

author: A Google User
comment: I'd pay for a premium app if it included a clock. The HTC digital clock has weather but its not BOM sourced and inaccurate.  Only thing missing.

author: Paul A Davies
comment: Comprehensive info, but can't get radar to open for any location. That's a major pain.
title: Radar doesn't work

author: Will Guyett
comment: Was a very good app had it for over a year however widget on main screen won't update anymore and you can't access app if you click on it
title: Playing up

author: Amanda V
comment: Keeps crashing every time I use it.  Used to be great now takes 2 goes to get it to open

author: Michael Pope
comment: Radar would not work on 5.0.2. Developer advised to update Google Android System Webview.  All is now perfect.
title: Simply the best AU weather app

author: Mike Bk
comment: Descriptions for Hobart are incorrect. Graphic and title says sunny, but the description says 90% chance of rain. I checked BOM - the description is for the current day, but shows on the following day's forecast.

author: Ivan Tomasic
comment: Fantastic app. My favourite is the compact layout of the widget with the forecast and UV index. Some paid apps can't even get this right. It would be even better if there were background options (e.g. transparent).

author: Andrew Ames
comment: Great weather app sourced from Bom. But can you increase the font size on the 4x1 widgets 3 day forecast part as my eyes aren't what they used to be. It's way to small. Otherwise it's fantastic.

author: Dave Bentley
comment: Very difficult to change the colors on the widget.(ok it's easy) but what if you want them all the same color

author: Gerard G
comment: Great app... Can we get current UV index on the widget, I think the UV currently is Max UV. It should update throughout the day

author: James Bennett
comment: Works well but not sure why it calls home to the devs website or why the website mimics a microsoft page

author: Melissa Beecham
comment: Great

author: Chris Solomon
comment: why does a weather app need access to my photos?
title: this isn't facebook

author: Sage
comment: Crash on startup

author: Linda Waugh
comment: This app used to be great.  However over the last week it no longer updates.  Reinstalled and still no updates.  Disappointed.
title: Gone from excellent to crap

author: A Google User
comment: I used to like it but the pop up ads have become so intrusive and unavoidable. I accidently hit one and Telstra instantly charged me $15 for a "third party" service. It then took days to get it fixed up. I have uninstalled.  My advice: Don't use this app.

author: Joe Gubbay
comment: Appreciate the development of this app to provide proper Australian weather forecasts. Impressed it integrates with android wear. It would be nice to have predicted rainfall amounts too.
title: Thanks for BOM weather

author: Mc Gondy
comment: One feature I would love is the ability to have the temperature on the status bar without having the widget. Can this please be added?
title: Great but...

author: Mike Bradley
comment: Make it go away!!!! Delete it and it comes back....you would get 5 star!!!  I was going to buy it. But I cant rely that my locale is being displayed...
title: Coconut island??

author: Adam Naylor
comment: A few issues with this version - Coconut Island?, Radar only works 5 % of time and app takes a long time to refresh anything
title: Prefer older version

author: Eric Lee
comment: Preferred last version

author: John Locker
comment: A very useful easy to use app
title: A top weather app

author: A Google User
comment: Nice app, have used it for a few years now. I even like the new version. There's one little problem, though, and I think you know what it is. Please make the Coconut Island temperature on the top bar go away! And let it show my station instead!!
title: Coconut Island??? Otherwise, love it!

comment: This app puts an icon in your notification area, that you have no way to turn off. It tells you the weather in the location closest to you, which it determines by GPS. if you have GPS turned off while not using it to save battery, it tells you the weather on coconut island. There is no way to turn this feature off, or change the default station. If I wanted to deal with bs like that, I'd buy an iPhone.
title: I don't live on coconut island

author: Michael J. Davis
comment: Remove the islands and set default to where I am and still only shows islands on widget and notify bar...shows right in the app itself...like the classic version!!
title: Don't live in coconut islands

author: A Google User
comment: Have used on phone and tablet for a few years. Is a great app with all the information I require straight from Bureau of meteorology. Accurate, quick, subtle yet neat widgets and better off all free. The latest major update is a real winner and has progressed this well performing app into a must have one.
title: Best weather

author: Matthew Harris
comment: changes location with new version. also uses HEAPS of battery %. loved the old version tho
title: coconut island ?????

author: Andrew Andrew
comment: No, no. I'm in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia 😂
title: Coconut Island?

author: Tim Burgoine
comment: Weather description have been removed!!  Why!!  It is the only feature that is missing!
title: Good app, BUT

author: Ilya Nik.
comment: Best and the most accurate weather app for Australia.

author: Gordon Alexander
comment: What da!!!!! Where the hell and what the hell does Coconut Island have to do with Sydney Western Suburbs? Turned on GPS just in case it needed to be on to get the location right. But nope, it insisted on a place somewhere in the middle of an ocean far far away. Errrrr, UNINSTALL!!!!!
title: Coconut Island?

author: Ian Hogben
comment: 32% of my battery drain was caused by this app. It is a great app but I can't use my phone with code this bad. Deleting.
title: Great app, murder on the battery

author: A Google User
comment: Update is fantastic. Thank you
title: Awesome

author: Dave Oswald
comment: It whines about my ad blocking software on every screen. Uninstalled.
title: Ok but

author: Hong Liu
comment: Just one small bug where ads seem to stack up when you view a location then go back to list
title: Very nice and informative

author: A Google User
comment: Adverts stack up until they almost fill the screen!

author: Sergej Kuzet
comment: I tried all and this one work the best for me.
title: The best au weather app
